text: <IDOCTYPE html> <html> <body> <script> function person(firstname, lastname, age, eyecolor) { this.firstname = firstname; _ this.lastname = lastname; Once you have a object this.age = age; constructor, you can create this.eyecolor = eyecolor; new instances of the object, } like this: var myFriend = new person("John","Doe",50,"blue"); document.write(myFriend.firstname + " is " + myFriend.age + " years old."); </script> </body> </html> //The this keyword in an object constructor does not have a value. It is only a substitute for the new object. //The value of this will become the new object when the constructor is used to create an object.
